content:
When populating a coverage eligibility request, we use Organization. US Core Organization requires "active", but our Organization data may be stale.

Is it preferable to assert "active: true (as of the last time we knew, which may have been a long time ago)", or to DAR the element as unknown?
Maybe I'm missing it in US Core, but couldn't you just say active=false? active is 1..1 MS, but it doesn't say it needs to be set to true.

but our Organization data may be stale.

I think Jay's saying that in this state, an organization's "active" status is best described as "unknown" rather than "true" or "false".

Most resources with status provide a set of codes rather than boolean. For example CanonicalResources like Questionnaire, CodeSystem, ValueSet, etc use https://build.fhir.org/valueset-publication-status.html which includes an explicit unknown code.
In those cases I would expect on org not to provide an active value. Forcing mandatory seems wrong if you're not the source for that info. (I.e. A directory)
Ahh, active is 0..1. Omitting is a great solution, but US core doesn't allow that.
so that's a #united states IG issue, rather than a #patient administration WG issue.
If that's the case, maybe lean towards a DAR as jay suggested.
This topic was moved here from #patient administration WG > "Active" Organization by Josh Mandel.
Worth considering changing Organization.active from 1..1 MS to 0..1 MS if we need to support "unknown" semantics.

But if the issue is "the Org says active=true but the data may be stale" rather than "we don't know the active status", then passing along a status and providing a timestamp so clients can evaluate freshness is OK too -- we approached a similar issue for SMART Scheduling Links using a lastSourceSync core extension, to explicitly convey the last synced time. See FHIR-31567 for details.

We will add a new extension on meta "lastSourceSync" as dateTime:

Definition: "Indicates when the data was last accessed from its original source"

Comment: "Relevant only on data that propagated from a system other than the current system."

For our case, I think active=true may be ok. It's stale, but it's what is known. And the effects are likely to be nil: we'd only send it because of the requirement. But it does seem like it might need attention.

According to US Core, you can use DAR extension for mandatory non-code element

For non-coded data elements, use the DataAbsentReason Extension in the data type
Use the code unknown - The value is expected to exist but is not known.
